animal_magnetism.name: Animal Magnetism

otherRewards: [[Ava's attractor]] if your [[Ranged]] level is less than 50, or [[Ava's accumulator]] if your Ranged level is 50 or higher
The ability to trade with [[Ava]] and purchase her [[Ava's device|devices]]

animal_magnetism.description: Draynor Manor has a new resident and, adventurers rejoice, she is a damsel in distress. Far from being Sleeping Beauty, she finds the Manor's beds not to her liking and is suffering from insomniac nights. If you fancy yourself able to aid Ava in her search for a good night's sleep, who knows what the budding scientist will produce as a reward?
items: [[Mithril axe]] (required to obtain the [[blessed axe]]; no other type of axe will do)
ironman: [[Mithril axe]] ({{SCP|Smithing|51|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}}); {{SCP|Thieving|28|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} for the [[Chest (Isle of Souls Dungeon)|Isle of Souls dungeon chest]]; {{SCP|Woodcutting|60|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} to purchase axe from [[Perry's Chop-chop Shop]] in the [[Woodcutting Guild]]; access to [[fairy rings]] ({{Fairycode|BKQ}}) and killing [[tree spirit]]s, blue dragons, or king sand crabs)
[[Holy symbol]] ({{SCP|Prayer|31|link=yes}} {{Boostable|no}})
animal_magnetism.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Asgarnia}} — location requirement{{RE|Morytania}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

another_slice_of_ham.name: Another Slice of H.A.M.

otherRewards: The [[ancient mace]]
The ability to buy [[Goblin Village]] [[Goblin village sphere|teleport sphere]]s
Free access to the [[Dorgesh-Kaan–Keldagrim train system]]

another_slice_of_ham.start: Go to [[Ur-tag]]'s house in [[Dorgesh-Kaan]]. (Can be reached either via Kazgar from the Lumbridge cellar or via Dartog from the water mill by telling either NPC to take the player to the mines. Afterwards, go south past the sword icon and enter the door.)
another_slice_of_ham.description: The dwarves are building a new underground rail link between their city of Keldagrim and the cave goblins' Dorgesh-Kaan, but work is being held up by the discovery of ancient goblin artefacts, and they need the help of a qualified archaeologist. Helping them out should be simple enough - unless you stumble upon another H.A.M. plot against the city.
items: Magic or Ranged [[equipment|gear]] for enemy fight ''(cannot use [[Melee]] on them)''

the_ascent_of_arceuus.name: The Ascent of Arceuus

otherRewards: A page for [[Kharedst's memoirs]], '[[A dark disposition]].' It teleports players to the centre of Arceuus.
Ability to recolour the [[graceful outfit]] to the colours of [[Arceuus]].
Ability to receive [[Arceuus signet]]s from [[Tyss]].
Ability to fight the [[Trapped Soul]] within the [[Nightmare Zone]].

the_ascent_of_arceuus.description: A long time ago, the citizens of Arceuus house gave up their human bodies and claimed immortality. This event was known as the Ascent of Arceuus and it marked the end of death within Arceuus house. Or so they believed. For the first time in a thousand years, a member of Arceuus house has fallen. You will need to solve the mystery of this death. However, time is of the essence and the fate of Arceuus house lies in your hands.

at_first_light.name: At First Light

otherRewards: Access to Master Tier [[Hunters' Rumours]]

at_first_light.start: Speak to [[Guildmaster Apatura]] at the [[Hunter Guild]].
at_first_light.description: Learn about the role of the Hunter Guild and unlock higher tier rumours.
items: [[Needle]] or [[costume needle]] (one needle spawns in [[Pellem's Fur Store]] nearby)
[[Box trap]] (can be bought from [[Imia's Supplies]] nearby)

below_ice_mountain.name: Below Ice Mountain

otherRewards: 2,000 coins
Access to the [[Ruins of Camdozaal]]
[[Flex]] emote
The ability to make a [[steak sandwich]]

below_ice_mountain.start: [[Willow (Below Ice Mountain)|Willow]] on the path south of [[Ice Mountain]]
below_ice_mountain.description: Willow, an energetic archaeologist (perhaps suspiciously so) is hunting for her next big discovery. She believes she has found the entrance to ancient underground ruins found to the west of Ice Mountain. There's a catch though - the entrance is sealed tight and she needs to re-unite her old crew to help her break in. Naturally, she has to stay close to the ruins in order to lay claim to the find, so it falls to you to bring her rag-tag group back together for one last caper and a final big pay-off. Burntof is an old dwarf with a penchant for demolition, Checkal is a well-built lifter of heavy things and Marley is a cunning thief with a knack for disarming traps. Together, they have the talents it will take to gain entry to the secret ruins. But persuading them might not be easy. See, the gang aren't all too keen on working with Willow again, and her intentions might not be as honourable as she claims...
items: [[Cooked meat]] (can be obtained during the quest)
below_ice_mountain.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Asgarnia}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

beneath_cursed_sands.name: Beneath Cursed Sands

otherRewards: Access to the [[Tombs of Amascut]]
A [[Keris partisan]]. (If your inventory was full, you may claim one for free from [[Selim]] in front of Al Kharid Palace.)

The [[circlet of water]], an untradeable helm that acts like a [[waterskin]] when worn. (If your inventory was full, you may claim one for free from the [[High_Priest_(Sophanem)|High Priest in Sophanem]].)
Jaltevas teleport option on the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]]. (Unlocked by selecting Commune on an obelisk in the necropolis, by the [[Necropolis mine|mine]].)

beneath_cursed_sands.start: Speak to [[Jamila]] at her stall in [[Sophanem]].
beneath_cursed_sands.description: When Sophanem was beset by a series of plagues, the gates to the golden city of Menaphos quickly closed. The city has been locked down ever since, with no one allowed to leave or enter. However, rumours have escaped of strange happenings inside Menaphos and there are stories of citizens mysteriously disappearing. These odd happenings need to be investigated, but few are willing to do so. Maisa, a spy from Al Kharid, has grown tired of inaction. She is determined to solve this mystery herself, but she won't be able to do it alone... are you up for the challenge?
items: Any cooked or raw meat (fish will not work; raw yak meat will not work; purchasable from shop during quest)
kills: [[Head Menaphite Guard]] (level 174) without the use of [[protection prayers]]

between_a_rock.name: Between a Rock...

otherRewards: A [[rune pickaxe]]
The ability to teleport to Dondakan's rock using a [[ring of wealth]]

You get to keep your [[gold helmet]] and can continue using it to fire yourself into the rock to access the [[Arzinian Mine]] where there are lots of [[gold rocks]] and [[gold vein]]s, and a nearby dwarf, at the river, banks the player's [[gold ore]] for a charge (he keeps 20% of the ores, rounded up, or 10% of the ores if the player has the [[ring of charos (a)]]).

between_a_rock.start: Speak to [[Dondakan the Dwarf]] at the [[Keldagrim south-west mine]].
between_a_rock.description: Hidden away from the fearsome trolls and the roaming Fremennik, the dwarves delve deep beneath the mountains in search for the ore they need to support their home of Keldagrim. One dwarf in particular, however, has for years been trying to crack open a rock that seems to be impervious to any material that he's tried on it. Convinced that solving the riddle of the rock will lead him to unimaginable wealth, he has spent the later part of his life on just this lump of stone. Help him out, but take care you don't end up in a tight spot!

other: The ability to defeat a level 75-125 enemy ''(depends on how much gold you mine)''

items: 4 [[gold bar]]s (You will need an extra bar and telegrab if you want to keep a [[golden cannonball]] for after the quest)
An [[ammo mould]] ''(can be bought for 5 coins during the quest)'' or a [[double ammo mould]]
between_a_rock.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Asgarnia}} — location requirement{{RE|Fremennik}} — location requirement{{RE|Kandarin}} — location requirement</poem>

big_chompy_bird_hunting.name: Big Chompy Bird Hunting

otherRewards: An [[ogre bow]]
The ability to fletch [[ogre arrow]]s
The ability to cook [[chompy bird]]s and earn a [[bowman hat]]

big_chompy_bird_hunting.start: Speak to [[Rantz]], far east of [[Feldip Hills]].
big_chompy_bird_hunting.description: Rantz the Ogre needs to feed his demanding children, Fycie and Bugs, so he wants to go Big Chompy Bird hunting. Problem is, he's all fingers and thumbs when it comes to making ogre arrows. Could someone please give him a hand?
items: Any [[axe]] that you can use ([[Blessed axe]] does not work)
[[Feather]]s (100 to be safe; coloured feathers from {{SCP|Hunter|link=yes}} work)
[[Knife]] (or {{Coins|10}} to buy a knife and chisel from [[Bugs]])
[[Chisel]] (or {{Coins|10}} to buy a knife and chisel from [[Bugs]])
4 [[wolf bones]] (can be obtained from level 64 [[wolves]] during the quest or from level 14 [[wolves]] in the [[Stronghold of Security]])
[[Cabbage]] (can be obtained during the quest, Draynor cabbage will not work)
[[Equa leaves]] (can be obtained during the quest)
[[Doogle leaves]] (can be obtained during the quest)
big_chompy_bird_hunting.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Kandarin}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Morytania}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Tirannwn}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

biohazard.name: Biohazard

otherRewards: The ability to travel freely through the [[West Ardougne]] gate.
The ability to use the [[West Ardougne Teleport]] in the [[Arceuus spellbook]] and teletab.

biohazard.start: Talk to [[Elena]] in her house in [[East Ardougne]].
biohazard.description: This is the second part of an ongoing adventure. Help Elena discover the truth about the infamous Ardougne plague. Smuggle test samples across Ardougne to Elena's old mentor.
items: [[Pigeon cage]] (Can be obtained during the quest. Found behind Jerico's house)
[[Priest gown top]] and [[Priest gown bottom|bottom]] (can be obtained during the quest for a total of 12 coins from Asyff's [[Fancy Clothes Store]])
[[Gas mask]] (can be obtained for free from the cupboard in [[Edmond]] and [[Alrena]]'s house in [[East Ardougne]])
biohazard.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Asgarnia}} — location requirement{{RE|Kandarin}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Tirannwn}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

black_knights_fortress.name: Black Knights' Fortress
black_knights_fortress.start: Speak to [[Sir Amik Varze]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk2}} of the [[White Knights' Castle]]'s western tower in [[Falador]].
black_knights_fortress.description: The Black Knights are up to no good. You are hired by the white knights to spy on them and destroy their secret weapon.
items: [[Cabbage]] (can be obtained from the cabbage patch in [[Edgeville Monastery]] and [[South Falador Farm]], as well as [[Lumbridge Castle#Cellar|Lumbridge cellar]]. Cabbages obtained from [[Draynor Manor]] '''CANNOT''' be used)
[[Iron chainbody]] (can be purchased at [[Horvik's Armour Shop]] in [[Varrock]] and from [[Wayne's Chains - Chainmail Specialist|Wayne's Chains]] in [[Falador]])
[[Bronze med helm]] (can be purchased in the helmet shop in [[Barbarian Village]], spawns by the backdoor of [[Draynor Manor]])

bone_voyage.name: Bone Voyage
bone_voyage.start: Talk to [[Curator Haig Halen]] in the [[Varrock Museum]].
bone_voyage.description: Curator Haig Halen needs your help to finish the construction of a barge fit to take the Varrock museum crew to an unexplored landmass to the east. There have been many attempts to reach the island, but none were successful. This quest will have you venturing across Gielinor, aiding the Varrock museum and making the success of the voyage a possibility.

cabin_fever.name: Cabin Fever

otherRewards: 10,000 [[coins]] (only if you speak to [[Bill Teach]] after the quest)
Access to [[Mos Le'Harmless]]
Access to kill [[cave horror]]s
The [[Book o' piracy]]
[[Charter ship]] prices are halved
Ability to play the [[Trouble Brewing]] minigame

cabin_fever.start: Talk to [[Bill Teach]] at [[The Green Ghost]] inn in [[Port Phasmatys]].
cabin_fever.description: It's war on the high seas as Bill Teach tries to make the journey from Port Phasmatys to the pirate enclave of Mos Le'Harmless! With his crew heading for the hills, he's looking to recruit anyone eager to become a pirate to help him sink the enemy before he ends up swimming home. He's offering a lot more than a shilling to join his crew. Have you got what it takes to be a pirate?

children_of_the_sun.name: Children of the Sun

otherRewards: Access to [[Varlamore]] through the [[Quetzal Transport System]] and [[fairy rings]]

children_of_the_sun.description: Children of the Sun begins on the familiar streets of Varrock, where a delegation from Varlamore has arrived to sign a treaty with the rulers of Misthalin. It’s a day for celebration, but something’s amiss… you’d better find out what’s going on!
children_of_the_sun.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Misthalin}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Varlamore}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

client_of_kourend.name: Client of Kourend

otherRewards: [[Kharedst's memoirs]]
[[Kourend Castle Teleport]] spell

client_of_kourend.description: Will you help Veos handle a mysterious client?
items: [[Feather]] ''(a [[Stripy feather|stripy]] or coloured feather can also be used, but a [[magic gold feather]] cannot)''
client_of_kourend.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Kourend}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

clock_tower.name: Clock Tower

otherRewards: 500 [[coins]]

clock_tower.start: Talk to [[Brother Kojo]] in the [[Clock Tower (building)|Clock Tower]] south of [[East Ardougne]].
clock_tower.description: Help the confused Brother Kojo find the missing cogs and fix his clock tower. Search the dungeon using brawn and brains to correctly place the four cogs.
items: [[Bucket of water]] (obtainable during quest) or [[Ice gloves]] or [[Smiths gloves (i)]]

cold_war.name: Cold War
cold_war.update: What's black and white and goes green when it's finished?

otherRewards: The ability to make the [[Clockwork suit|penguin suit]]. To enter the suit again, you must talk to [[Larry]] again at the [[Ardougne Zoo|zoo]], pier, or [[Iceberg]]
The ability to use the [[Penguin agility course]]
Players can also steal more [[cowbells]] and make more [[Penguin bongos|bongos]]. The cowbells or the bongos can only be played in a penguin suit.

cold_war.description: At the Ardougne Zoo, one of the zookeepers has become a bit preoccupied by penguins. In fact, he's downright paranoid about them. He needs your help to observe their habits on the iceberg in the Lunar Sea. What begins as a peaceful bird-watching expedition opens a new world of espionage and bad musicians.
ironman: {{SCP|Woodcutting|50|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} for the mahogany plank
cold_war.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

contact.name: Contact!

otherRewards: The [[Keris]] dagger
Access to [[Sophanem]]'s shops including: [[bank]], [[Blades by Urbi.]], [[Nathifa's Bake Stall.]], [[The Spice Is Right.]]
The music track [[Back to Life]] and [[The Spymaster]]
nlocks:
[[Giant scarab]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

contact.start: Speak to the [[High Priest (Sophanem)|High Priest of Icthlarin]] in [[Sophanem]].
contact.description: The High Priest of Icthlarin has problems again - this time with the inhabitants of Menaphos. Sophanem is recovering from the plague, yet most of its citizens are still trapped on the other side of the river. Diplomacy has failed and subterfuge beckons. Clearly, this is the sort of job that a shifty adventurer could excel in.
items: A [[Light sources|light source]] ([[Kandarin headgear]], [[Firemaking cape]], [[Abyssal lantern]] or a [[bruma torch]] are extremely recommended as they can't be extinguished by traps in the [[Sophanem Dungeon|dungeon]]). If you don't have one, the [[Sophanem guard]] under the temple of the lesser deities will sell you an [[unlit torch]] for 200 [[coins]].

A [[tinderbox]] (unless you have the [[Kandarin headgear]], [[Firemaking cape]], [[Abyssal lantern]] or a [[bruma torch]]). If you don't have one, the [[Sophanem guard]] will sell you one for 50 coins.

cooks_assistant.name: Cook's Assistant

otherRewards: Permission to use the [[Cooking range (Lumbridge Castle)|Cook-o-matic 100]], which reduces the chance of burning some [[food]]s.

cooks_assistant.start: Speak to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] in the kitchen of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
cooks_assistant.description: The Lumbridge Castle cook is in a mess. It is the Duke of Lumbridge's birthday and the cook is making the cake. He needs a lot of ingredients and doesn't have much time.
cooks_assistant.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Misthalin}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Kandarin}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Morytania}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

the_corsair_curse.name: The Corsair Curse
the_corsair_curse.update: The Corsair Curse and Wilderness Chaos Altar

otherRewards: Access to [[Yusuf]]'s bank in the [[Corsair Cove]].
nlocks:
[[Corsair Traitor]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

the_corsair_curse.start: Speak to [[Captain Tock]] at the crossroads north of [[Port Sarim]].
the_corsair_curse.description: From the newly revealed town of Corsair Cove, deep in the south of Feldip Hills, the captain of the Corsairs has sailed to Port Sarim seeking help. His crew is sick, and he suspects that a curse has been laid upon them. If you can unravel the fearful and conflicting tales of ogre relics, vengeful mermaids and demonic possession, maybe you can help his ailing crew overcome The Corsair Curse.

creature_of_fenkenstrain.name: Creature of Fenkenstrain

otherRewards: The [[Ring of charos]], which allows access to the [[Werewolf Agility Course]], and, when activated during [[Garden of Tranquillity]], reduced cost to many transport links.

creature_of_fenkenstrain.start: Read the signpost in the middle of [[Canifis]].
creature_of_fenkenstrain.description: [[Dr Fenkenstrain]], master and sole occupant of the castle to the north-east of [[Canifis]], needs a new servant to go on a dark errand for him. Do you have the stomach to help Fenkenstrain complete his twisted purpose?

other: Able to defeat a level 51 monster and run past level 72 monsters

ironman: {{SCP|Smithing|4|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} (to make a [[bronze wire]])
creature_of_fenkenstrain.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Kandarin}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Morytania}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

darkness_of_hallowvale.name: Darkness of Hallowvale
darkness_of_hallowvale.update: Myreque Pt III - Darkness of Hallowvale

otherRewards: Access to passage through two shortcut doors within Meiyerditch

darkness_of_hallowvale.start: Go to [[Burgh de Rott]] and into the basement of the inn there and speak to [[Veliaf Hurtz]].
darkness_of_hallowvale.description: Fighting tooth and nail against the vampyre overlord, Drakan, the Myreque have moved their secret base camp to Burgh de Rott. Now the fight starts in earnest! Veliaf needs someone to make their way into the Sanguinesti region, the eastern side of Morytania cut off from the west behind an impenetrably huge wall. Will the fight be supported by Myreque resistance inside the vampyres' domain? What grim discoveries are to be found behind that dread wall? And what of the Vyrewatch - deadly sky-bound patrollers of the blood-tithed lands of Meiyerditch? Only a daring, quick-witted agent with an eye for detail can hope to pick their way through the tumbled down slums of Meiyerditch.

other: The ability to withstand several melee attacks from a level 169 enemy.

items: Means to cast [[Telekinetic Grab]] ([[air rune|air]] and [[law rune]]; both obtainable during the quest)

death_on_the_isle.name: Death on the Isle
death_on_the_isle.update: Varlamore: The Rising Darkness is OUT NOW

otherRewards: A [[costume needle]] from the [[costumer]]
The [[butler's tray]] and an assortment of masks from the [[Head Butler]]
The ability to unlock the North [[Aldarin]] teleport destination via the [[pendant of ates]]

death_on_the_isle.start: Speak to [[Patzi]] by the entrance to [[Villa Lucens]].
death_on_the_isle.description: Solve a mysterious murder on the island of Aldarin.

death_plateau.name: Death Plateau

otherRewards: [[Steel claws]]
The ability to make [[claws]]
Ability to purchase and wear [[climbing boots]] from [[Tenzing]]

death_plateau.start: Talk to [[Denulth]] in his tent in [[Burthorpe]]. Tell him you will discover the path for him.
death_plateau.description: Trolls have come down from the north and are camped on Death Plateau. They are using this base to launch attacks on the principality of Burthorpe! The Imperial Guard is taking heavy losses. They need your help!
items: 60 [[coins]] (bring 1000 for the gambling dice with Harold part)
[[Asgarnian ale]] (can be found on the bar at the pub in [[Burthorpe]])
ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] Players need 21 empty inventory spaces to deliver items to Tenzing.

death_to_the_dorgeshuun.name: Death to the Dorgeshuun

otherRewards: [File:Welcome to Dorgesh-Kaan.png|thumb|You are granted access to the Dorgeshuun city!]]
Access to the [[H.A.M. Store room]], where you can loot gems, jewellery, and coins from chests
Access to the water wheel tunnel ([[Dartog]] will appear there, and you'll be able to travel between the [[Lumbridge Castle]] cellar, the [[Dorgeshuun Mines]] and the water wheel tunnel at will)
Ability to use the [[bone dagger]] and [[Dorgeshuun crossbow]] [[special attack]]s
Access to [[Dorgesh-Kaan]], the [[Dorgeshuun]] city
A [[torch]] if you did not have a light source in your inventory at the end of the quest

death_to_the_dorgeshuun.description: Humans have been visiting the Dorgeshuun mines for some time now, but no Dorgeshuun has visited the surface since the signing of the Lumbridge-Dorgeshuun treaty. The Dorgeshuun Council fears that the [[Humans Against Monsters|H.A.M.]] group may be planning another attack, and want to send an agent to the surface to investigate. But they do not want to send someone to the surface without a guide...
items: Any [[light source]] ([[lantern]]s are recommended - open light sources such as a [[candle]] can cause [[gas explosion]]s and require a [[tinderbox]])

2 full sets of [[H.A.M. robes]] (all 7 pieces) (chance to receive robes is significantly higher during the quest){{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1112039679547850752|date=30 March 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/3JZZ6|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=Are you on the bit of the quest where you need it? If so, the chance of you getting HAM kit is considerably higher.}}
[[Pickaxe]] (if not using a [[games necklace]] to teleport to [[Tears of Guthix (minigame)|Tears of Guthix]]) - only usable after you have completed the [[Tears of Guthix]] quest

defender_of_varrock.name: Defender of Varrock

otherRewards: Access to [[Zemouregal's Base]]
[[Antique lamp]] rewarding 5,000 XP in any skill of at least level 30 and 5 [[Kudos]] from [[Historian Minas]] after completion of the quest

defender_of_varrock.start: Speak to [[Elias White]] in the [[Jolly Boar Inn]].
defender_of_varrock.description: Long ago, one man wielding a magic shield stood against the undead armies of the Mahjarrat. His name was Arrav, and he was strong and noble, but the fates had spoken: his downfall at the hands of the evil necromancer Zemouregal was inevitable. In one last desperate act to save his people, Arrav flung the shield towards the town now known as Varrock, protecting it from further harm. In that very moment, Zemouregal struck him down. Standing over the fatally wounded hero, Zemouregal made a promise: "When I return, you shall lead my armies. You shall be my greatest champion, and suffer under the knowledge that while you hoped to save your people, you will instead be their doom." Now, there is fear in the air. Whispers of the dead rising. Could this be the time of the prophesied return?
items: [[Chaos core]] (Can be obtained during the quest)
[[Barronite deposit]] or a [[pickaxe]] to mine one

demon_slayer.name: demon_slayer
Demon Slayer

otherRewards: [[Silverlight]] (if lost, players may retrieve it from [[Sir Prysin]] for a fee of 500 [[coins]].)
5 [[Kudos]], which [[members]] can claim by talking to [[Historian Minas]] in the [[Varrock Museum]]

demon_slayer.start: Speak to [[Aris]] in the tent on the western side of [[Varrock Square]].
demon_slayer.description: A mighty demon is being summoned to destroy the city of Varrock. You find out you are the one destined to stop him (or at least try).
items: [[Bucket of water]] (can be obtained during the quest)
25 [[bones]] (can't be [[noted]], but can be delivered in increments)

the_depths_of_despair.name: The Depths of Despair
the_depths_of_despair.update: The Queen of Thieves & The Depths of Despair

otherRewards: A page for [[Kharedst's memoirs]], '[[Lunch by the lancalliums]]'. It teleports players to just east of the [[Hosidius Kitchen]].
Ability to recolour the [[graceful outfit]] to the colours of [[Hosidius]].
Ability to fight the [[Sand Snake]] within the [[Nightmare Zone]].

the_depths_of_despair.start: Speak to [[Lord Kandur Hosidius]] at his home in [[Hosidius]], north-west of the [[Vinery]].
the_depths_of_despair.description: Artur Hosidius has gone missing, and Lord Kandur Hosidius needs your help to find his son and bring him home.

desert_treasure_i.name: Desert Treasure I

otherRewards: The ability to use [[Ancient Magicks]]: At any time, you can pray at the [[Altar (Ancient Pyramid)|altar]] and change between the [[Standard spells|standard]] and Ancient Magicks spellbooks. After traversing the pyramid for the first time, you may enter via the back-door of the pyramid to gain a short cut to the altar. Be warned that changing spellbooks will drain your prayer to 0.
[[Ring of visibility]]: If you ever lose it, you can obtain another one from [[Rasolo]].
Access to [[ancient staff]]: You can buy one from [[Eblis]] for 80,000 [[coins]]. If you lose the staff, you will have to reobtain it from another source.
Access to the [[Smoke Dungeon]], which can be used for various [[Slayer task]]s.
Ability to talk to [[Eblis]] to obtain an [[ancient signet]].
nlocks:
[[Dessous]], [[Damis]], [[Fareed]], and [[Kamil]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

desert_treasure_i.start: Speak to [[Asgarnia Smith]] at the [[Bedabin Camp]].
desert_treasure_i.description: Rumours abound throughout Varrock and Al-Kharid that an archaeologist has discovered clues to a hoard of treasure hidden deep in the desert, south of Al-Kharid. Anybody prepared to offer him assistance in his treasure hunting could well find themselves benefitting from a very large reward indeed...
items: 10+ [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]]es '''or''' a way to enter the [[Kharidian Desert]] without one
[[Bones]] (can be noted to prevent accidental burial)
[[Garlic powder]] (made by grinding [[garlic]] in a [[pestle and mortar]])
[[Spice]] ([[gnome spice]] and [[Evil Dave]]'s spices will '''not''' work)
A sweet ([[cake]], [[chocolate cake]] (part cakes are accepted), or [[chocolate bar]])
[[Spiked boots]] (obtainable during the quest by bringing [[Dunstan]] [[climbing boots]] and an [[iron bar]]; do so '''before''' attempting to obtain the [[ice diamond]])
[[Climbing boots]] (if [[Eadgar's Ruse]] isn't completed and/or you lack 61 [[Magic]] for the [[Trollheim Teleport]])
kills: You will also need to tank hits by many high level enemies throughout most parts of the quest.
ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player briefly visits [[Entrana]].
Player will need to obtain [[Magic logs]]; see the "enchanting the mirrors" section for more information

desert_treasure_ii_the_fallen_empire.name: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire
desert_treasure_ii_the_fallen_empire.image: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire.png|300px
desert_treasure_ii_the_fallen_empire.update: Desert Treasure II - The Fallen Empire

otherRewards: Access to [[Scar essence mine]]
[[Ring of shadows]]
The ability to wear [[ancient rings]].
The ability to repeat [[the Forgotten Four]] encounters as boss fights, along with the ability to challenge their [[Awakener's orb|awakened]] variants.

desert_treasure_ii_the_fallen_empire.description: During Gielinor's Second Age, the world was dominated by an empire the likes of which had never been seen. The areas now known as Asgarnia, Misthalin and even the Wilderness all once flourished under the banner of the Empty Lord. With the grand city of Senntisten at its heart, this civilisation washed over Gielinor like an unstoppable tide, pushing the boundaries of magic and science, while crushing any who stood in their way. Fast forward to today, the Fifth Age, and you won't find much trace of this ancient empire. Indeed, Saradominists and Zamorakians alike have spent many lifetimes purging all remnants of it. However, small fragments of this fallen empire remain, for those who know where to look. Perhaps you’ve already encountered some of these remains. Maybe you’ve met the monstrous Nex, sealed behind the Frozen Door for millennia. Or perhaps you’ve visited the bandits of the Kharidian Desert, the final human followers of the Empty Lord. You might even have encountered some mysterious Mahjarrat hidden away beneath those same sands. However, there are other parts of this forgotten empire that even you won’t have encountered yet. For example, this story begins deep in the desert, within a mysterious vault...
items: Runes to cast [[Blood Burst]], [[Ice Burst]], [[Smoke Burst]], and [[Shadow Burst]]
[[Pestle and mortar]] (can be obtained during quest)
kills: A number of lesser demons, black demons, and abyssal creatures
desert_treasure_ii_the_fallen_empire.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questAccess to [[The Whisperer]] in {{RE|Asgarnia}}, [[Duke Sucellus]] in {{RE|Fremennik}}, and [[Vardorvis]] in {{RE|Varlamore}} do not require {{RE|Desert}} to be unlocked</poem>

devious_minds.name: Devious Minds
devious_minds.start: Talk to the [[Monk (Devious Minds)|monk]] outside [[Paterdomus]], next to the [[River Salve]].
devious_minds.description: No-one likes to miss a good ceremony, least of all a poor lowly monk who needs your assistance! Will you be able to aid him and make his dreams come true?
ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player visits [[Entrana]] for a portion of the quest. Plan ahead as the Large Pouch with the orb in it is lost on death.

'''{{Colour|red|Warning:}}''' [[File:Hardcore_ironman_chat_badge.png]] The quest involves travelling via the [[Abyss]] located in level 4-7 [[Wilderness]], with a chance of getting killed by other players.
devious_minds.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Asgarnia}} — location requirement{{RE|Morytania}} — location requirement{{RE|Wilderness}} — location requirementOnly possible to manually complete if the [[Wanted!#Random_items|random locations]] in the prerequisite quest [[Wanted!]] are in the 3 required regions of {{RE|Asgarnia}}, {{RE|Morytania}} and {{RE|Wilderness}}Unlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

the_dig_site.name: The Dig Site

otherRewards: 2 [[gold bar]]s

Show the museum [[Curator Haig Halen|curator]] the [[Level 3 certificate]] to choose between something to drink ([[Fruit blast]]) or something to eat ([[chocolate cake]]). Get the cake for [[Desert Treasure I]] / [[A Tail of Two Cats]] or the [[fruit blast]] for [[Recipe for Disaster]]. Make sure that you go through the dialogue for each one that you give it or he will not give you a chance to pick which reward you want and you will receive nothing.
The ability to do [[Kudos#Uncleaned finds|Varrock Museum specimen cleaning]] to obtain a [[Digsite pendant]].

the_dig_site.start: Talk to an [[examiner]] in the [[Exam Centre]] south of the [[digsite]].
the_dig_site.description: Feeling uneducated? Desperate for buried treasure? "There's gold in them there hills" (well stream actually) as well as many other items that can be found at the digsite. Join the students in their attempt to be a qualified archaeologist, and become experienced in making the earth move! Have you got what it takes to unearth the hidden altar to one of RuneScape's lesser-known Gods?
items: [[Cup of tea]] (can be stolen from the [[Varrock]] [[Ye Olde Tea Shoppe|tea stall]])
2 [[rope]]s (can be stolen from a [[Digsite workman]], but with average luck, this can easily take more than 15 minutes.)
[[Opal]] or uncut opal (small chance to acquire while panning for a quest item)
[[Charcoal]] (obtainable during the quest, but may take some time)

dorics_quest.name: Doric's Quest

otherRewards: 180 [[coins]]
The ability to use [[Doric]]'s [[anvil]]s
Bronze pickaxe given at the start of the quest

dorics_quest.start: Speak to [[Doric]] in the small house north of [[Falador]], just outside the east gate of [[Taverley]].
dorics_quest.description: Doric the dwarf is happy to let you use his anvils but first he would like you to run an errand for him.
ironman: {{SCP|Mining|15|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}}, ''OR''
The ability to kill monsters such as [[Flesh Crawler]]s, [[Mind Golem|Mind]]/[[Body Golem]]s, or [[Iron ore#Item sources|other monsters]] for their [[iron ore]] drops.
dorics_quest.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Asgarnia}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

Access to [[Crandor]]
Access to the [[Corsair Cove Resource Area]]
The ability to be assigned Dragons as a Slayer task (obtainable immediately after starting the quest)

dragon_slayer_i.description: Prove yourself a true champion. Kill the mighty dragon Elvarg of Crandor and earn the right to buy and wear the Rune platebody.
items: [[Unfired bowl]] (can be made with [[soft clay]] on a [[Potter's Wheel]] with {{SCP|Crafting|8}} [[Crafting]])
[[Wizard's mind bomb]] (can be bought in the [[Rising Sun Inn]] in [[Falador]] or [[The Toad and Chicken]] in [[Burthorpe]])
[[Lobster pot]] (can be bought from any [[Fishing shops|fishing shop]])
[[Silk]] (can be bought from [[Thessalia]] for 30 coins or the [[Al Kharid]] silk stall for 3 coins -- members can steal it from the [[Ardougne]] [[silk stall]] with {{SCP|Thieving|20}} [[Thieving]])
[[Magic]]/[[ranged]] [[weapon]] as well as a [[law rune|law]] and [[air rune]] (to cast [[Telekinetic Grab]] if your Magic level is 33 or higher) '''or''' 10,000 coins
[[Anti-dragon shield]] (Can be obtained during the quest)
90 [[steel nails]] (Members can buy these from the [[Sawmill operator]] north-east of [[Varrock]], they can also be smithed at {{SCP|Smithing|34}} [[Smithing]] using 6 [[steel bar]]s by all players)
ironman: {{SCP|Crafting|8}} [[Crafting]] (to create an [[unfired bowl]])
{{SCP|Smithing|34}} [[Smithing]] (to create [[steel nails]] for [[free-to-play]])

dragon_slayer_ii.name: Dragon Slayer II

otherRewards: Ability to speak to cats without the [[Catspeak amulet]]
Access to the [[Myths' Guild]]
*Access to the pettable [[Dog (Myths' Guild)|dog]]
*Ability to make [[super antifire potion]]s by speaking to [[Primula]]
*Access to [[Fountain of Uhld]] where dragonstone jewellery (excluding the [[ring of wealth]]) can be recharged
*Access to the [[Pool of Dreams]] where players can choose to fight [[Galvek]] again or rewatch [[cutscene]]s from the quest
*Access to the [[Wrath Altar]]
*Access to the shop to buy the [[mythical cape]]
Access to [[adamant dragon|adamant]] and [[rune dragon]]s in the [[Lithkren Vault]]
Access to a stronger version of [[Vorkath]] on [[Ungael]]
Ability to reforge the [[dragon platebody]] and [[dragon kiteshield|kiteshield]]
Ability to have a [[Rune dragon (Construction)|rune dragon]] as a [[Treasure Room]] guardian (requiring 99 [[Construction]] and 25,000,000 [[coins]])
Ability to create an [[Ava's assembler]] by bringing [[Vorkath's head]], 75 [[Mithril arrow]]s, and 4,999 coins (or [[Ava's accumulator]]) to [[Ava]] in [[Draynor Manor]]
Ability to craft [[Ferocious gloves]] from [[Hydra leather]] in the [[Lithkren Vault]] (requires a hammer)
Ability to construct [[Mythical cape (mounted)]] in your POH
Ability to go back through the [[ancient doors]] on [[Lithkren]] and use your [[Digsite pendant]] on the Strange Machine north of the dragons. This will allow you to teleport there.

dragon_slayer_ii.start: Speak to [[Alec Kincade]] outside the [[Myths' Guild]].
dragon_slayer_ii.description: 30 years prior to the fateful day a mighty adventurer awakened Elvarg from her slumber, Crandor was a thriving and very much alive island, with a great tradition of mages and adventurers. The history of Crandor is a bold one, enough so that many a Crandorian earned the right to be part of the Champions' Guild! The Crandor we know today is very different from that of the past and there are so many questions that remain unanswered - your chance to uncover the secrets of the past starts with Dragon Slayer II.
items: At least 12 [[nail]]s of any kind ('''Note:''' Bringing more is recommended; nails may bend!)
Runes for 3 [[Fire Wave]] spells '''or''' 3 [[Fire Surge]] spells

dream_mentor.name: Dream Mentor

otherRewards: 7 new spells added to your [[Lunar spells]] book ([[Monster Examine]], [[Humidify]], [[Hunter Kit (spell)|Hunter Kit]], [[Stat Spy]], [[Dream]], [[Plank Make]], [[Spellbook Swap]])
[['Birds-Eye' Jack]] will now allow you to use the bank without a [[seal of passage]] equipped or in your inventory.
nlocks:
[[The Untouchable]], [[The Everlasting]], [[The Inadequacy]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

dream_mentor.start: Talk to the [[Cyrisus|fallen man]] in the small cave in the [[Lunar Isle mine]].
dream_mentor.description: Gielinor is not the safest place to live - dragons, trolls, demons... dangerous and despicable monsters of all sorts roam free. In this quest, you must help a fellow adventurer that doesn't do so well against these threats. With perseverance and the magical help of the Moon Clan, there should be no monster that can't be beaten. But is that really true? How about the monsters in your dreams? How about your own inescapable fears? How would you defeat them? Well, you'll soon find out as a tough and often bizarre quest awaits those of a strong will!

other: The ability to defeat 4 powerful monsters without the use of prayer

items: 3 different kinds of [[food]]: 6 of 1 type and 7 of 2 others for a total of 20 pieces (Sacks of [[cabbages]], [[potatoes]], and [[onions]] can be used as they each contain 10 piece of their respective [[food]] and only require a total of 3 inventory slots. Fruit baskets also work.)
A good [[weapon]] ''([[trident of the seas]] recommended because they have no magic defence)'', good [[armour]], good food such as [[shark]]s, and [[super potion set]]s.
ironman: [[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] '''Note''': As opposed to the dream world in Lunar Diplomacy, the dream world in Dream Mentor is not safe and dying here is the same as dying in the rest of Gielinor: you will lose your hardcore status. The lectern is the '''only''' way to leave, as no other teleports will work (including the ring of life).

druidic_ritual.name: Druidic Ritual

otherRewards: The ability to use the [[Herblore]] [[Skills|skill]]

druidic_ritual.start: Speak to [[Kaqemeex]] in the stone circle north of [[Taverley]].
druidic_ritual.description: The Druids north of Taverley need help making a potion to reclaim the stone circle south of Varrock.

dwarf_cannon.name: Dwarf Cannon

otherRewards: The ability to buy and use a [[dwarf multicannon]]
The ability to make [[cannonball]]s
[[Titles|Membership of the Black Guard]]

dwarf_cannon.start: Talk to [[Captain Lawgof]], south of the [[Coal Trucks]], north-west of the [[Fishing Guild]].
dwarf_cannon.description: For several years now, the Dwarven Black Guard have been developing the latest in projectile warfare. With the constant attack of goblin renegades, the dwarven troops who protect the mines need to put this secret weapon into action. Only with your help can the true power of this cannon be harnessed!

eadgars_ruse.name: Eadgar's Ruse

otherRewards: The ability to grow and steal [[Goutweed]], which can be traded with Sanfew for herbs.
1 Burnt Meat
The ability to use the [[Trollheim Teleport]] spell.
The ability to use a [[Scroll of redirection]] to redirect a [[Teleport to house (tablet)|Teleport to house tablet]] to Trollheim.

eadgars_ruse.start: Talk to [[Sanfew]] in upper floor of the building where [[Jatix's Herblore Shop]] is in [[Taverley]].
eadgars_ruse.description: Sanfew requires a rare herb for the next part of the purifying ritual. Travel back to the Troll Stronghold to find this herb that the trolls use as an ingredient for their favourite dish.
items: [[Vodka]] (sold by [[Funch's Fine Groceries|Heckel Funch]] at the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] bar for 5 coins)

[[Pineapple chunks]] (pineapples are sold by [[Funch's Fine Groceries|Heckel Funch]] at the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] bar or any [[Charter_ship|Charter Ship]], use a knife to dice the pineapple into chunks)
1 [[Logs|Log]] (2-3 logs and a [[tinderbox]] may be helpful)
10 [[Grain]] (obtainable during the quest, just south of [[Tegid]])
5 [[Raw chicken]] (there are chickens on the way at [[Tenzing]]'s house. Undead chickens do not work)
ironman: A [[grimy ranarr weed]] can be acquired by killing [[Chaos druids]]. (1/32.4)
