merlins_crystal.description: The wizard [[Merlin]] has been trapped in a magical crystal by the witch [[Morgan Le Faye]]. So far, King Arthur hasn't been able to figure out how to free his mentor from his crystal prison. Can you help?
items: [[Bucket of wax]] (obtainable during the quest with [[Insect repellent]], a bucket spawns near the beekeeper)
merlins_crystal.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Asgarnia}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Kandarin}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

misthalin_mystery.name: Misthalin Mystery

otherRewards: [[Uncut ruby]]
[[Uncut emerald]]
[[Uncut sapphire]]

misthalin_mystery.start: Speak to [[Abigale]] (or [[Hewey]], who sits next to her) in the south-eastern corner of [[Lumbridge Swamp]], near the [[fishing spots]].
misthalin_mystery.description: A woman cries as a man lays dying, desperately they beg you to stop a cryptic killer before their friends suffer a similar fate.

monks_friend.name: Monk's Friend

otherRewards: 8 [[Law rune]]s
Brother Omad will throw parties for you by speaking to him.

monks_friend.start: Speak to [[Brother Omad]] at the [[Ardougne Monastery]] south of [[East Ardougne]].
monks_friend.description: A monk's child has had their blanket stolen. Find the thieves' den and return the blanket, then help Brother Omad organise the drinks for the child's birthday party.

monkey_madness_i.name: Monkey Madness I

otherRewards: 3 [[Diamond]]s
The ability to buy and wield the [[Dragon scimitar]].
Full access to Ape Atoll, with the exception of the bank and javelin store, which are unlocked after [[Monkey Madness II]].
fter the quest, players retain the ability to turn into a monkey in Ape Atoll & [[Ardougne Zoo]], using the [[Monkey greegree]]. The [[Jungle Demon]] can also now be fought in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

monkey_madness_i.start: Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]].
monkey_madness_i.description: The King of the northern Gnomes, Narnode Shareen, is once again in need of your help. He recently decided to send an envoy of his Royal Guard, the 10th squad, to oversee the decommissioning of the Gnome owned ship-building facilities on the eastern coast of [[Karamja]]. It has been quite some time since the 10th squad were dispatched and they have been deemed missing in action. It will be up to you, should you decide to help, to find out what fate befell the 10th squad and if possible, track them down. If only it were so simple. Sinister forces have begun to spread through the Gnome hierarchy and threaten to unleash an unknown terror upon the world. Far across the land, the fires of vengeance are being stoked once again. Can you unravel the mystery behind the deception? Can you separate the truth from the lies? Can you decide for yourself what is real and what is not?
items: [[Monkey bones]] or [[Monkey corpse|corpse]] from [[Karamja]] (obtainable during quest)
ironman: {{SCP|Smithing|40|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} (to make the gold bar if not dropped by a monster) or {{SCP|Magic|33|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} (to telegrab a gold bar from [[Varrock west bank]] basement.) A gold bar is also a reward from [[The Digsite]], [[Goblin Diplomacy]], and [[Waterfall Quest]]

monkey_madness_ii.name: Monkey Madness II
monkey_madness_ii.developer: Mod Jed, Ian Gower, Mod Ash, Mod Maz, {{RSL|Mod Bond

otherRewards: A [[Royal seed pod]], which provides unlimited teleports to the [[Grand Tree]] (up to level 30 [[Wilderness]]).
Access to the [[Crash Site Cavern]] containing [[demonic gorilla]]s.
Access to a new [[Maniacal monkey (Hunter)|maniacal monkey]] hunting area where Glough's laboratory used to be in [[Kruk's Dungeon]].
Access to [[Ape Atoll]] bank and [[Oobapohk's Javelin Store]].
Access to new [[glider]] spot directly to Ape Atoll.
The ability to communicate with monkeys without the [[monkeyspeak amulet]].
All [[NPC]]s on the surface of [[Ape Atoll]] will be [[non-aggressive]] without requiring the use of [[Monkey greegree]]s.
Ability to wield the [[heavy ballista]].
Various dragons will now drop [[dragon javelin heads]].
The ability to reclaim lost Greegrees from [[Zooknock]] in his Gnome Stronghold house (no supplies required).
A [[Monkey (Monkey Madness II)|Monkey]] can be found in one of the [[crate (Crash Site)|crates]] at the Crash Site. It is purely cosmetic and can be equipped in the cape slot.
[[Bobawu]] will now track your laps of the [[Ape Atoll Agility Course]], with you being able to transform your monkey into other variants upon completing a number of laps.

monkey_madness_ii.start: Talk to [[King Narnode Shareen]] in the [[Grand Tree]]. (You must have '''all the requirements''' to start the quest).
monkey_madness_ii.description: Glough, the war criminal set on eradicating humans and overthrowing Gielinor, has escaped the watch of the Grand Tree gnomes. With a history of leaving large-scale conflicts and warfare in his wake, Glough must be tracked down and stopped. King Narnode Shareen needs your help.
items: A [[pickaxe]] (if you choose the tanking route)
A [[slash weapon]] (to slash webs if you choose the tanking route - [[Wilderness sword]] of any tier recommended for this due to 100% web slash ability).
The [[Translation book]] from [[The Grand Tree]]. If you have lost it a replacement can be obtained from King Narnode during the quest.
ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The player briefly visits [[Entrana]].

mountain_daughter.name: Mountain Daughter

otherRewards: The [[Bearhead]]
The ability to pass into the [[Mountain Camp]] over the rockslide
nlocks:
[[The Kendal]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

mountain_daughter.start: Talk to [[Hamal the Chieftain]] in the [[Mountain Camp]] east of [[Rellekka]]. To get in, take the path north of the [[Golden Apple Tree]] and use a [[rope]] on the boulder behind the guard (see below for more details).
mountain_daughter.description: Ages ago, a small tribe of people split off from the Fremennik in Rellekka and decided to inhabit the mountains to the east of town. There they lived as nomads for many years, but now the chieftain of the camp has lost his daughter and will not move on before she has been found. Has she run away, has she been eaten by trolls, or is there something more sinister going on? Only you can find out.
items: [[Staff]] or a [[pole]] (obtainable during the quest, [[Dramen Staff]] does not work, but [[elemental staves]] and [[Lunar staff]] do work)
[[Gloves]] (excluding: [[Slayer gloves|Slayer]], [[Mystic gloves|Mystic]], [[Ranger gloves|Ranger]], [[Moonclan gloves|Moonclan]], [[Lunar gloves|Lunar]], [[vambraces]], and random event apparel)

mournings_end_part_i.name: Mourning's End Part I

otherRewards: Access to the [[Mourner HQ]] basement and the village of [[Lletya]]
[[Elf teleport crystal]]
The [[fixed device]]
Full [[Mourner gear|mourner clothing]]

mournings_end_part_i.start: Talk to [[Eluned]] inside the elven woods of [[Isafdar]].
mournings_end_part_i.description: It seems at last Arianwyn has need of your skills. He believes there is more to the Mourners than meets the eye and he wishes for you to find out just what they're up to. Can you gain the trust of the Mourners?

other: The ability to defeat a level 11 enemy with your combat stats set to 20 each.

items: [[Bear fur]] (can be obtained during the quest near Jorral's Outpost)
Each of these [[dye]]s: [[red dye|red]], [[yellow dye|yellow]], [[green dye|green]], and [[blue dye|blue]] (can be bought during the quest for {{NoCoins|6|c}} each).
[[Bucket of water]] (can be bought from the general store in LLetya during the quest, and used on the well)
[[Rotten apple]] ('''must''' be the rotten apple on the ground north of the [[Mourner Headquarters]] in [[West Ardougne]], obtainable during the quest)
[[Barrel of naphtha]], or 5-9 [[coal]] to make one
7 empty inventory spaces for the [[Mourner gear]]
ironman: {{SCP|Woodcutting|75|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} for [[Magic log]] ''(if chopping)''
Magic logs can also be obtained from the [[Reward Cart]] after defeating the [[Wintertodt]] skilling boss, requiring {{SCP|Firemaking|50|link=yes}} {{Boostable|no}} to participate.

mournings_end_part_ii.name: Mourning's End Part II

otherRewards: A [[crystal trinket]], which allows you to enter the Temple of Light again after the quest
Access to the [[Death Altar]]
[[Death talisman|Death talismans]] can be obtained via [[Guardians of the Rift]]
[[Death rune|Death runes]] can now be crafted during [[Guardians of the Rift]]
Access to [[Dark Beast]]s
[[Dark Beast]]s teleport enabled in [[Slayer Ring]]s menu

mournings_end_part_ii.description: This chapter of the quest takes our hero deep under the mountains of Arandar to put a stop to the evil plans of the mourners. If our hero is to succeed, they must solve one of the most complicated puzzles in all of Gielinor.
items: A [[chisel]] (one can be found in the house south of the Mourner HQ)
A [[death talisman]]/[[death tiara|tiara]], [[catalytic talisman]]/[[catalytic tiara|tiara]], [[Runecraft cape]]  or [[Mourning's End Part II#The Death Altar|50 junk items]]
ironman: ''Optional:'' {{SCP|Slayer|90|linkyes}} to kill [[dark beasts]] for a [[death talisman]] ''or'' completion of [[Temple of the Eye]] to be able to participate in [[Guardians of the Rift]], where a [[catalytic talisman]] may be obtained randomly from the [[rewards guardian]].

murder_mystery.name: Murder Mystery
murder_mystery.start: The [[Sinclair Mansion]], north along the path between [[Seers' Village]] and [[Camelot]]. Talk to one of the guards around the mansion.
murder_mystery.description: Old man Sinclair has been found dead in his mansion! Unfortunately, the local authorities are having some trouble figuring out who's the guilty party. Maybe the unbiased eye of a passing adventurer will be of help.

my_arms_big_adventure.name: My Arm's Big Adventure
my_arms_big_adventure.update: Would you like to see My Arm?

otherRewards: Access to a disease-free [[herb patch]] on top of the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]]. This patch does not allow growing of regular [[Goutweed]].
29 [[Burnt meat]]
nlocks:
[[Giant Roc]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

my_arms_big_adventure.start: The kitchen, deep in the [[Troll Stronghold (location)|Troll Stronghold]]. Talk to [[Burntmeat]].
my_arms_big_adventure.description: Trolls love goutweed. They love it so much that they've picked it all, and now they can't get any more. However, in his smelly kitchen in the Troll Stronghold, Burntmeat the cook has heard a rumour that goutweed is growing once again, for anyone who's got the skill to farm it. Can you teach his young assistant - a simple troll known as My Arm - to grow the precious goutweed? Will you overcome My Arm's stubbornness and ignorance to earn yourself Burntmeat's reward? Dare you accompany My Arm on this uniquely trollish expedition?
items: [[Bucket]] (can be obtained during the quest, south of the cooking pot on [[Death Plateau (location)|Death Plateau]])
3 [[Ugthanki dung]], or the following materials to gather it:

Several farming supplies, which can be stored by any [[Tool Leprechaun]] and withdrawn from the [[Tool Leprechaun (Larry)|Trollheim Tool Leprechaun]]. He sells all of these '''except''' for supercompost:
my_arms_big_adventure.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Asgarnia}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

nature_spirit.name: Nature Spirit

otherRewards: Access to [[Mort Myre Swamp]] and the Nature Spirit altar, where you can replenish and temporarily boost your [[prayer]] points by 2
Ability to fight [[ghast]]s
3 meat pies and 3 apple pies unless they were rotted by the [[ghast]]s
Ability to build the [[fire of dehumidification]] after completion of [[Making Friends with My Arm]]

nature_spirit.start: Speak to [[Drezel]] under the Paterdomus Temple near the [[River Salve]].
nature_spirit.description: After saving the holy man Drezel, he's seeking some assistance again. This time he has a special request for any adventurous sorts to search for the Druid 'Filliman Tarlock' and brave the terrors that infest the swamp of Mort Myre.
items: [[Silver sickle]] - either purchase it from the [[Grand Exchange]], or make it with a [[silver bar]] and [[sickle mould]] in a furnace at 18 [[Crafting]]. Ironmen can buy a [[silver bar]] from the [[Silver merchant]] in [[Ardougne]].
ironman: {{SCP|Crafting|18|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} (in order to create a [[silver sickle]])

a_night_at_the_theatre.name: A Night at the Theatre

otherRewards: * If players completed the quest before 28 July 2021 and have already used the original two antique lamps that were rewarded, they will only receive two additional antique lamp upon re-completing the quest.

a_night_at_the_theatre.start: You can start this quest by talking to the Mysterious Stranger inside Ver Sinhaza, south-east of Meiyerditch.
a_night_at_the_theatre.description: The Mysterious Stranger lurks outside of the mighty Theatre of Blood, the centrepiece of Ver Sinhaza. This shadowy figure has a new request for you – to humiliate a vampyre noble by the name of Lady Verzik Vitur. Take on the challenges that lie within the Theatre to reach her and bring a blush to her bloodless face!
items: [[Ghostspeak amulet]] ([[Morytania legs 2]] or better also work)

observatory_quest.name: Observatory Quest

otherRewards: Your item reward depends on what astrological sign you see when you look through the telescope. It is different for each person. Each one rewards an [[uncut sapphire]] as well as the following:
*Aquarius: 25 [[water rune]]s
*Cancer: An [[amulet of defence]]
*Gemini: A [[black 2h sword]]
*Libra: 3 [[law rune]]s
*Pisces: 3 [[tuna]]
*Sagittarius: A [[maple longbow]]
*Scorpio: [[Weapon poison]]
*Taurus: A 1-dose [[super strength]] potion
The [[Spirit of Scorpius]] will now give you a [[Unholy mould|mould]] to make [[unholy symbol]]s, and he will bless them for you too. He can be found in the graveyard north of the [[Observatory]].
Talk to the [[Observatory assistant]] after the [[quest]] and he will reward you with a [[jug of wine]] as well as tell you his and the professor's real name.
Access to the grappling [[shortcut]] rock outside the Observatory.
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 [[Kudos]] which can be claimed by talking to [[Historian Minas]] in the [[Varrock Museum]].

observatory_quest.start: Talk to the [[Observatory professor]] in the [[Observatory]] Reception Room north of [[Castle Wars]].
observatory_quest.description: The Observatory in south-west Ardougne has been ransacked by a family of nearby goblins. Can you help the professor to rebuild it?
kills: [[Goblin guard]] ''(level 42)'' (Optional – can simply be trapped behind a column)

olafs_quest.name: Olaf's Quest

otherRewards: 4 cut [[ruby|rubies]]
Access to a cave where you can fight [[brine rat]]s.

olafs_quest.start: Speak to [[Olaf Hradson]] by the isthmus leading to the [[Rellekka Hunter area]].
olafs_quest.description: Poor Olaf Hradson. He has to live up to such expectations. His ancestors sailed all over the world, and now he has to go out and prove himself their equal. If only he could read a map... If only he could sail... If only he hadn't crashed! Can you help a depressed and soggy Fremennik regain his pride, and possibly the lost treasure of his grandfather?

other: The ability to defeat a level 100 monster

items: 4 free [[inventory]] slots (10 if not bringing your own ropes)

one_small_favour.name: One Small Favour

otherRewards: A [[steel key ring]]
The ability to make [[Guthix rest]] tea
The ability to craft [[pot lid]]s
Access to the [[gnome glider]] route to the [[Feldip Hills]]
nlocks:
[[Slagilith]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

one_small_favour.start: Speak to [[Yanni Salika]] in [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]].
one_small_favour.description: If you're new to Shilo Village after solving the mystery (or even if you did it some time ago), you may like to check out Yanni Salika's antiques shop. He's a busy chap, revamping antique items, checking out new stock from potential adventurers and maybe he'll have a small<sup>(1)</sup> favour to ask of you? Probably nothing particularly large, Yanni isn't a demanding<sup>(2)</sup> person, should hardly take you any time<sup>(3)</sup> at all really, something to do when you have a spare moment. That's assuming there aren't any complications. 1: - Perception of the word "small" may be open to interpretation. 2: - In a recent vote, Yanni Salika was only voted the second most demanding person in Shilo Village. 3: - As everyone knows, time is relative.
items: The ingredients required to make a [[Guthix rest]]:
Two of each of the following gems HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: (Two of each gem are obtained uncut during the quest but must be cut before using, with a high chance to crush them)
one_small_favour.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Kandarin}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest'''The quest is otherwise not completable.'''</poem>

the_path_of_glouphrie.name: The Path of Glouphrie
the_path_of_glouphrie.developer: Mods Chihiro and Tytn (original), Mod Ed (Old School)

otherRewards: Access to the [[Poison Waste Dungeon]]
Ability to unlock [[warped creatures]] as a [[Slayer task]] which drop the [[warped sceptre]]
Access to a new [[spirit tree]] destination in the [[Poison Waste]]

the_path_of_glouphrie.start: Speak to [[King Bolren]] in the [[Tree Gnome Village (location)|Tree Gnome Village]].
the_path_of_glouphrie.description: King Bolren has a new pet. Unfortunately, it's another watcher, like the ones unmasked in the Tree Gnome Stronghold during The Eyes of Glouphrie. Has Glouphrie been watching the Tree Gnome Village, too? If you investigate further you'll find out more about Glouphrie, the history of the gnomes (and their unusual monarchy) and maybe you'll get within a hair's breadth of the lost city of Arposandra...
items: [[Key (Tree Gnome Village Dungeon)|Tree Gnome Village Dungeon key]] (unless [[Roving Elves]] has been started)
ironman: {{SCP|Fletching|59|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} to make a [[mith grapple]]
{{SCP|Smithing|59|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}} to make a [[mith grapple tip]]

{{SCP|Firemaking|35|link=yes}} {{Boostable|no}} for [[Barbarian Firemaking]], to access the [[Ancient Cavern]], and the means to defeat level 132 enemies for a 1/42.67 chance at a [[mith grapple]] drop (ideally the [[skeleton brute]]).

perilous_moons.name: Perilous Moons

otherRewards: Access to [[Neypotzli]] and the [[Moons of Peril]]
n addition, completing the quest counts as a normal defeat of the Moons of Peril, allowing the player to loot the [[Lunar Chest]] for further rewards.

perilous_moons.start: Speak to [[Zuma]] or [[Attala]] at the entrance to [[Cam Torum]].
perilous_moons.description:
Beneath the steep and jagged cliffs of Ralos' Rise sits the dwarven town of Cam Torum. Its strong fortifications have kept it safe through all of Varlamore's history... but now the inhabitants face a new challenge.

Lurking below the surface is an ancient temple, built to contain powerful entities. Now, the earth has been disturbed – and the dwarves need your help to keep these strange beings contained!

pirates_treasure.name: Pirate's Treasure
pirates_treasure.update: The island of Karamja is open

otherRewards: Ability to use the pay-fare option to and from [[Karamja]].
Access to [[Casket (Pirate's Treasure)|One-Eyed Hector's Treasure Chest]] (contains a [[gold ring]], an [[emerald]], and 450 [[coins]]).

pirates_treasure.start: Speak to [[Redbeard Frank]] at the northernmost dock at [[Port Sarim]], just outside [[The Rusty Anchor]].
pirates_treasure.description: Redbeard Frank knows the location of pirate treasure, but he'll only part with the knowledge for a bottle of [[Karamjan rum]].
items: [[Karamjan rum]] (obtainable during the quest for 30 coins)
[[White apron]] (obtainable during the quest in Port Sarim at [[Gerrant's Fishy Business.]])
60 [[coins]] (only 30 is needed if using a [[Ring of charos|Ring of charos(a)]])
pirates_treasure.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Asgarnia}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Morytania}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

plague_city.name: Plague City
plague_city.start: Talk to [[Edmond]], living next to the wall surrounding [[West Ardougne]], north of [[Ardougne Castle]].
plague_city.description: The western part of Ardougne has been shut off as a deadly plague sweeps through the people. However, a young woman who went in to try to help those stricken by the illness has disappeared and her parents have become worried.
items: [[Dwellberries]] (Spawns in [[McGrubor's Wood]], squeeze through the loose railing, use {{Fairycode|ALS}}, or [[Telekinetic Grab]] them. They can be bought from [[Heckel Funch]] or [[Hudo]] in the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]] or grown with 36 [[Farming]].)
[[Rope]] (Purchasable in the [[East Ardougne]] [[general store]], [[Port Khazard]] [[general store]], [[Ned]], or a spawn in [[Karamja]] general store.)
4 [[Bucket of water|buckets of water]] (Can be used one-by-one, there is a [[water source]] and [[bucket]] spawn near Edmond)
[[Hangover cure]] or the ingredients to make one:
ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] The [[hangover cure]] can be made before the quest starts by combining milk, chocolate dust, and snape grass to conserve inventory space.

[[File:Group ironman chat badge.png]] The [[hangover cure]] itself is an '''untradeable item''' so if preparing for Group Ironman, do not premake these as you will be unable to share them with your group through Group Storage or Trading.
plague_city.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Kandarin}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Tirannwn}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

a_porcine_of_interest.name: A Porcine of Interest

otherRewards: 30 [[Slayer reward point]]s
Access to the [[Sourhog Cave]] and [[Sourhog]] slayer tasks from Spria
Existing [[slayer helmet]]s will have [[reinforced goggles]] added to them
[[Spria]] will now be able to give you slayer tasks

a_porcine_of_interest.start: Read the town [[Notice board (Draynor Village)|notice board]] in [[Draynor Village]], behind [[Fortunato]]'s [[Wine Shop]].
a_porcine_of_interest.description:
Ah, the Falador Farm - filled with cabbages, cows, and even a sleepy sheepdog. A peaceful place, where you can learn to churn butter, give a dog a bone, or purchase various Farming supplies. What was once a place of happiness, joy and wholesome dairy goods has of late become dominated by a vile presence. Each morning Sarah wakes to find her crops destroyed, her cows cowering, and her loyal sheepdog looking... sheepish.

She's had enough, but she thinks she's got the culprit on the trot. Can you help her track down... A Porcine of Interest?
items: [[Knife]] or a [[slash weapon]] (except [[abyssal whip]], [[abyssal tentacle]], or [[dragon claws]]) (obtainable during the quest)

priest_in_peril.name: Priest in Peril

otherRewards: [[Wolfbane dagger]], prevents the citizens of [[Canifis]] from transforming into werewolves when attacked
Route to [[Canifis]] and [[Morytania]]
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 [[Kudos]] which can be claimed by talking to [[Historian Minas]] in the [[Varrock Museum]].

priest_in_peril.start: Speak to [[King Roald]] in the [[Varrock Palace]].
priest_in_peril.description: Recently contact has been lost with the temple to Saradomin on Misthalins' Eastern border. [[King Roald]] would be very interested to know what has caused this lack of communication, and seeks an adventurer willing to report back to him on the situation.
items: 50 unnoted [[rune essence]] or [[pure essence]] (can be mined by talking to [[Aubury]] in [[Varrock]], after completing [[Rune Mysteries]]. All 50 essence does not have to be of the same type.)
[[Bucket]] (spawns above the Varrock Castle's kitchen in the north-easternmost room (go to the kitchen, and climb up the stairs))
kills: [[Temple guardian]] dog ''(level 30) You cannot use [[Magic]].'' A [[Ring of recoil]] will not register that you killed the [[Temple guardian]] without inflicting at least 1 damage yourself.
[[Monk of Zamorak]] ''(level 30).'' A [[Ring of recoil]] will not allow key drops without inflicting at least 1 damage yourself.

prince_ali_rescue.name: Prince Ali Rescue
prince_ali_rescue.update: Yet another new quest, and new options menu

otherRewards: 700 [[coins]]
Free passage through the [[Lumbridge]] - [[Al Kharid]] toll gate from now on.
(Members) Access to the [[Sorceress's Garden]] [[Thieving]] [[minigame]].
(Members) Use of the window shortcut at the rear of [[Al Kharid Palace]] (requires 70 [[Agility]]).

prince_ali_rescue.start: Speak to [[Hassan]] in the palace at [[Al Kharid]].
prince_ali_rescue.description: Prince Ali of Al Kharid has been kidnapped by the scheming Lady Keli. You are hired to stage a rescue mission.
items: [[Bucket of water]] or [[jug of water]] (obtainable during quest)
[[Rope]] (can be bought during the quest at [[Ned]] for 18 [[coins]] or 4 [[balls of wool]])

the_queen_of_thieves.name: The Queen of Thieves
the_queen_of_thieves.update: The Queen of Thieves & The Depths of Despair

otherRewards: A page for [[Kharedst's memoirs]], '[[The fisher's flute]].' It teleports players to the centre of Port Piscarilius.
Ability to recolour the [[graceful outfit]] to the colours of [[Port Piscarilius]].

the_queen_of_thieves.start: Speak to [[Tomas Lawry]] outside the [[Port Piscarilius]] bank.
the_queen_of_thieves.description: The gangs of Kourend have recently been uniting under a mysterious figure called the Queen of Thieves, somewhere in Port Piscarilius. This novice quest tasks the player with infiltrating the gangs of Kourend in order to find the Queen of Thieves.
items: [[Stew]] ''(Cooking ingredients can be obtained during quest for 6 [[coins]]. Requires 25 [[cooking]])''

rag_and_bone_man_i.name: Rag and Bone Man I
rag_and_bone_man_i.start: Speak to the [[Odd Old Man]], located at the end of the northern path in central [[Silvarea]].
rag_and_bone_man_i.description: Everybody needs some body, and the Odd Old Man knows exactly which bits of those bodies he needs. Can you help him finish his extensive and extremely creepy collection?
items: 8 [[coins]] for 8 [[pot of vinegar|pots of vinegar]] (bring 68 coins if walking to and from [[Karamja]] for boat fare)
8 [[logs]] of any type (or an [[axe]] to obtain them)

rag_and_bone_man_ii.name: Rag and Bone Man II

otherRewards: qp = 1
[[Bonesack]]
[[Ram skull helm]]

rag_and_bone_man_ii.start: Speak to the [[Odd Old Man]], located at the end of the northern path in central [[Silvarea]].
rag_and_bone_man_ii.description: An archeological bone gathering quest. Requires the start and/or completion of multiple quests. Lots of creatures and animals necessary to be scavenged for specific bones, that will then need to be cleaned and given to the [[Odd Old Man]] for his marvelous collection of bone remains.

other: The ability to kill several high-level monsters

items: 27 sets of [[logs]] (any logs - normal logs can be obtained on the path just below the [[Odd Old Man]]'s hut if you bring an [[axe]]).
Combat gear to kill [[zogre]]s (an [[ogre composite bow]] with [[brutal arrow]]s or runes for [[Crumble Undead]] casts is advised)
[[Mirror shield]] or [[V's shield]] (unless using a workaround - see guide for how to get around using this)
rag_and_bone_man_ii.leagueRegion: <poem>Impossible to complete, as it requires visits to {{RE|Asgarnia}}, {{RE|Kandarin}}, {{RE|Desert}}, {{RE|Fremennik}}, and {{RE|Morytania}}. As such, players are advised not to start the quest, so that the quest-specific bones do not pollute the ground. If the player has started the quest, the pollution can be avoided by keeping the bone in the inventory or bank.</poem>

ratcatchers.name: Ratcatchers

otherRewards: A [[rat pole]]
The ability to train overgrown cats into [[Wily cat|wily]] and [[lazy cat]]s.
The ability to name your wily or lazy [[cat]] (up to six letters long).
Access to the [[Rat Pits]].
The ability to use the [[Grouping]] teleport to the rat pits in [[Port Sarim]], [[Ardougne]], [[Varrock]], and [[Keldagrim]].

ratcatchers.description: Gertrude knows of some ratcatchers in Varrock, pay her a visit and she may tell you of their whereabouts. Perhaps they could show you and your cat a few pointers about rat catching. Enter the subterranean world of the rat catchers and discover more of your cat's true potential.
items: Any type of [[cat]] or [[hellcat]] (for most of the quest, a cat with a high successful [[rat catch rate]] is recommended, and [[overgrown cat]]s cannot be used there -- during the [[Ratcatchers#Hooknosed Jack|Hooknosed Jack part]] of the quest, any cat with strong [[Cat#Combat_stats|combat stats]] is recommended)
[[Rat poison]] (if cheese is not already poisoned; can be found in the [[Clock Tower Basement]]), or made during the quest with the following items:
[[Snake charm]] (obtained from [[The Feud]] or during the quest)
ratcatchers.leagueRegion: <poem>Impossible to complete, as it requires visits to {{RE|Asgarnia}}, {{RE|Desert}}, {{RE|Kandarin}}, and {{RE|Fremennik}}</poem>

recipe_for_disaster.name: Recipe for Disaster

otherRewards: n total, completing all 10 subquests for "Recipe for Disaster" awards:
Access to the following areas:
*[[Mogre Camp]]
*[[Evil Chicken's Lair]]
Ability to dive for crabs
Ability to cook [[crab meat]]
Ability to catch [[hell-rat]]s
Ability to own a [[hellcat]]
Ability to add coloured spices to [[stew]]s of any sort
Ability to use the boat trip to travel between [[Karamja]] and [[Feldip Hills]]
[[Ape Atoll Teleport (standard)|Ape Atoll Teleport]] spell
Full access to [[Culinaromancer's Chest]]
*Access to [[Kitchen weaponry]]
*Access to the banking chest (under Lumbridge Castle)
*Access to a food store in the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]]
*Access to buy [[Barrows gloves]]
nlocks:
[[Evil Chicken]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]] on completion of [[Recipe for Disaster/Freeing Sir Amik Varze|Recipe for Disaster - Freeing Sir Amik Varze]] subquest.
[[Agrith-Na-Na]], [[Flambeed]], [[Karamel]], [[Dessourt]], [[Gelatinnoth Mother]], [[Culinaromancer]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]] after quest completion.

recipe_for_disaster.start: Speak to the [[Cook (Lumbridge)|Cook]] in the kitchen of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
recipe_for_disaster.description: The cook in Lumbridge has a surprisingly small number of ingredients on hand in his kitchen, possibly as a result of an endless stream of newcomers with light fingers, taking anything that isn't nailed down from his kitchen. Luckily, in the past, a kind [[Cook's Assistant]] was willing to help him in his culinary duties, but a problem has now appeared that could spell... a '''Recipe For Disaster'''! Almost all members may attempt to solve his tricky predicament, and be rewarded accordingly, but only the very elite of Questers will be able to put an end to his problem permanently!

other: All prerequisite quest requirements
The ability to defeat high leveled monsters, several of which have to be defeated without using {{SCP|Prayer|link=yes}}
Completion (or partial completion where stated) of the following quests:

items: Any [[fruit blast]] excluding a [[premade fr' blast]]
About 320 [[coins]] ''(or 120 if you have the activated [[Ring of charos]])''
[[Bowl of water]] ''(an [[empty bowl]] can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
[[Bucket of water]] ''(an [[Bucket|empty bucket]] can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
3 [[buckets of milk]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
[[Spice]] or [[gnome spice]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
[[Cake tin]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
Any [[cat]] except an [[overgrown cat]] ''(you'll be [[chase|chasing rats]], so a [[wily cat]] is recommended)''
[[Raw chompy]] ''(several recommended in case of burning)''
[[Ogre bow]] and several [[ogre arrows]] ''(10 is enough)''
2 [[pots of flour]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
[[Pot of cornflour]] ''(or raw [[sweetcorn]] and an [[empty pot]])''
[[Pot of cream]] ''(can be bought from the [[Culinaromancer's Chest]])''
[[gorilla greegree|Gorilla]], [[ninja greegree|ninja]] and [[zombie greegree]] ''(or 3000 [[coins]] and combat equipment if making the greegrees during the quest)''
recipe_for_disaster.leagueRegion: <poem>Partially completable — Requires {{RE|Varlamore}} or {{RE|Fremennik}} for [[Greenman's ale]] to complete [[Another Cook's Quest]]. (A [[Fruit blast]] can be obtained in {{RE|Misthalin}} by talking to an [[Examiner]] for [[Level 3 certificate]], handing it over to [[Curator Haig Halen]] and asking for a drink.)Alternately, unlocking {{RE|Kandarin}} or {{RE|Morytania}} will auto-complete [[Another Cook's Quest]].</poem>}}</onlyinclude>===Another Cook's Quest==={{Main|Recipe for Disaster/Another Cook's Quest}}[[File:Cook (Lumbridge) chathead.png|left]]The cook is preparing for a party in [[Lumbridge]]. He tells the player that a hundred years ago, a very important meeting was held in Lumbridge. Supposedly his ancestor, [[Franizzard Van Lumbcook]], cooked such an amazing banquet for the occasion that he was offered a job as head cook, along with all his descendants, for life.This big, important meeting is held in Lumbridge every ten years and today is the 10th meeting. As he cannot think of a brilliant dish himself, he intends to use his ancestor's recipe for the feast. However, he needs help gathering the ingredients, again. Gather the ingredients and complete the subquest to receive an invitation to The Feast. All but the [[rotten tomato]] can be obtained from the Grand Exchange. You can buy one from [[Pelters' Veg Stall]] behind the [[Varrock General Store]], or head to the bank chest at the Emir's Arena in [[Al Kharid]] to obtain one from the barrel.Items required: [[eye of newt]], [[Greenman's ale|glass of greenman's ale]], [[rotten tomato]] and [[Dirty blast|dirty blast ( fruit blast + ashes )]].===The Feast==={{Listen

recruitment_drive.name: Recruitment Drive

otherRewards: Access to [[initiate armour]]. You will be given a [[Initiate sallet|sallet]] for free, and you can buy subsequent sallets from Sir Tiffy Cashien for 6,000 [[coins]], the [[Initiate cuisse|cuisse]] for 8,000 coins, the [[Initiate hauberk|hauberk]] for 10,000 coins, or the full set for 20,000 coins. It is aesthetically similar to [[White equipment#Armour|white armour]], with a gold trim.
The Gaze of Saradomin - When you die, you will have the option of returning to [[Falador]] instead of [[Lumbridge]]. Talk to [[Sir Tiffy Cashien]] to change your spawn point at any time.

recruitment_drive.start: Speak to [[Sir Amik Varze]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk2}} of the [[White Knights' Castle]]'s western tower in [[Falador]].
recruitment_drive.description: The Temple Knights of Saradomin, a secret organisation founded many centuries ago by Saradomin himself, are currently looking to expand their ranks with some new blood. After the successful thwarting of the Black Knights' plans to take over Asgarnia, and with the personal recommendation of Sir Amik, you have now been offered the chance to apply for membership in this organisation... but are you up to the challenge?
ironman: [[File:Hardcore ironman chat badge.png]] You will lose your Hardcore ironman status if you die to Sir Leye.
[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] This quest requires an empty inventory and no items worn.
recruitment_drive.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Asgarnia}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

regicide.name: Regicide

otherRewards: Access to the elven kingdom of [[Tirannwn]] and the overpass of [[Arandar]]
The ability to wield the [[dragon halberd]] (With level 60 [[Attack]] and 30 [[Strength]])
The ability to charter a [[Charter ship|ship]] to [[Port Tyras]]
The ability to use [[Iorwerth camp teleport]] scrolls

regicide.start: Talk to [[King Lathas]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk1}} of [[Ardougne Castle]].
regicide.description: Continuing the Plague City series, the Regicide Quest takes you beyond the 'Well of Voyage' to a new realm. King Lathas will employ you once again, this time for the grim task of disposing of his brother. Upon travelling to the realm you will find yourself surrounded by new and strange plants, animals and even a new race. Once there, you will see that everything is not as serene as it first appears.
items: 5 [[coal]] in the bank (although at least 25 is recommended; you may bring the coal noted to save you a bank trip)
[[Bow]] and some [[arrows]] (or [[fire arrows|lit fire arrows]] if you already have some.)
[[Limestone]] (or a [[pickaxe]] and {{SCP|Mining|10+|link=yes}}). Note that [[limestone brick]]s will '''not''' work.
[[Strip of cloth]] (made on a [[loom]] with 4 [[balls of wool]]; '''not''' a [[bolt of cloth]] - you can use the [[loom]] at the [[Iorwerth Camp]] or at the [[Falador]] farm)
[[Gloves]], the list on [[Quicklime]] shows all gloves that work.

the_restless_ghost.name: The Restless Ghost

otherRewards: [[Ghostspeak amulet]] (keep for several quests and content in the future)

the_restless_ghost.start: Speak to [[Father Aereck]] in the chapel south-east of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
the_restless_ghost.description: A ghost is haunting [[Lumbridge]] graveyard. The priest of the Lumbridge church of [[Saradomin]] wants you to find out how to get rid of it.

the_ribbiting_tale_of_a_lily_pad_labour_.name: The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour Dispute
the_ribbiting_tale_of_a_lily_pad_labour_.image: The Ribbiting Tale of a Lily Pad Labour Dispute.png|300px

otherRewards: Access to a new [[Hardwood]] Farming patch

the_ribbiting_tale_of_a_lily_pad_labour_.description: Solve a ribbiting dispute and gain access to a new [[Special_patches#Special_tree_patches|hardwood Farming patch]].
items: Any axe (a [[bronze axe]] is obtainable during the quest)

romeo_juliet.name: Romeo & Juliet
romeo_juliet.description: [[Romeo]] and [[Juliet]] are desperately in love, but Juliet's father doesn't approve. Help them to find a way to get married and live happily ever after.

roving_elves.name: Roving Elves

otherRewards: [[Crystal shield]] or [[crystal bow|bow]] with 500 charges
nlocks:
[[Moss Guardian]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

roving_elves.start: Talk to [[Islwyn]] inside the elven woods of [[Isafdar]].
roving_elves.description: Deep in the elven forests of Isafdar, live a duo of roving elves: Islwyn a grumpy, old elf who dislikes humans and his companion, [[Eluned]], who is a beautiful, friendly, young female elf with a kind heart. In this quest, you are challenged to overcome Islwyn's prejudice against humans and alleviate the burdens of the past.
items: [[Glarial's pebble]] (can be obtained during the quest)
[[Key (Waterfall Dungeon)|Key]] (can be obtained during the quest)
kills: [[Moss Guardian]] ''(level 84)'' (has to be killed with [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|restricted items]], can be [[flinched]])
ironman: [[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] You must briefly visit Glarial's Tomb which has [[Glarial's Tomb#Restricted items|significant item restrictions]]. Items dropped outside the tomb may be picked back up within three minutes.

royal_trouble.name: Royal Trouble
royal_trouble.start: Go to [[Miscellania]] and speak to [[Advisor Ghrim]] in the castle.
royal_trouble.description: It's tough being a regent of a small island kingdom, especially when the [[King Vargas|king]] has declared war while you were adventuring. Something is up in [[Miscellania]] and [[Etceteria]], so you'd better find out what before both kingdoms end up in royal trouble.
items: 5 [[coal]] (obtainable during the quest with a [[pickaxe]], which will also be obtainable)
1 [[plank]] (obtainable from a spawn during the quest)

rum_deal.name: Rum Deal

otherRewards: The [[Holy wrench]] (while in your inventory, this grants more [[prayer points]] when drinking a [[prayer potion]])
Access to [[Braindeath Island]]

rum_deal.start: [[Pirate Pete]], at a dock due north of [[Port Phasmatys]].
rum_deal.description: Zombie pirates have arisen on [[Braindeath Island]], and they don't look friendly! Production of 'rum' has stopped, and the pirate brewers are running scared. Can you overcome the horde of drunken, undead pirates? Can you even get to the island without getting a splitting headache?
items: [[Seed dibber]] (obtainable during the quest) or partial completion of the [[Farming]] portion of the [[Barbarian Training]] [[miniquest]]
At least 47 [[prayer points]] for the ''[[Rum Deal#Evil spirits|Evil spirits]]'' part of the quest

rune_mysteries.name: Rune Mysteries

otherRewards: The ability to mine [[rune essence]]
An [[air talisman]]
The ability to use [[lamp]]s and [[Book of Knowledge|books of knowledge]] from [[random events]] on [[Runecraft]]
Completing this quest awards the player with 5 [[Kudos]] which can be claimed by talking to [[Historian Minas]] in the [[Varrock Museum]].

rune_mysteries.start: Speak to [[Duke Horacio]] on the {{FloorNumber|uk1}} of [[Lumbridge Castle]].
rune_mysteries.description: Recent research at the [[Wizards' Tower]] has found a way to create Runes for the first time in centuries. Assist the head wizard Sedridor in his research and he too may teach you these secrets!

scorpion_catcher.description: Thormac the Sorcerer has a hobby involving scorpions. Unfortunately, three of them have escaped and managed to run far away. If you manage to find them all, he may just be able to perform an important service for you.

[[Oyster pearls]]

sea_slug.description: Something strange is happening on the [[Fishing Platform]]. Missing fishermen and the presence of dozens of strange sea creatures gives cause for concern. Investigate the platform, discover the truth before it's too late.
items: [[Swamp paste]] (made by mixing [[flour]] with [[swamp tar]] then cooking the mixture on a fire; can also be bought from a [[Trader crewmember]] for 75 coins, from [[Rasolo]] for 60 coins west of the [[Fishing Guild]], or from the [[Khazard General Store]] for 42 coins at full stock)

secrets_of_the_north.name: Secrets of the North

otherRewards: Ability to mine [[ancient essence crystals]] in the [[Ghorrock Dungeon]]
Access to a stronger version of the [[Strange Creature]], the [[Phantom Muspah]]

secrets_of_the_north.start: The [[Carnillean Mansion]] in the south-west corner of [[East Ardougne]]
secrets_of_the_north.description: Our story begins - as all good murder mysteries do - with a mysterious murder, and there's no shortage of suspects - in fact, you're one of them! Be prepared to form an uneasy alliance, dig up secrets best left buried deep, and walk away with more questions than answers...
secrets_of_the_north.leagueRegion: <poem>Unlocking {{RE|Desert}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the questUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest '''but will not auto-complete''' [[Desert Treasure I]]</poem>

shades_of_mortton.start: Find the [[Diary (Shades of Mort'ton)|Diary of Herbi Flax]] on a shelf in a house at the village of [[Mort'ton]].
shades_of_mortton.description: The townsfolk of [[Mort'ton]] have some form of strange affliction and the town is full of Shades. Can you find some way to reverse this?

other: Must be able to survive an onslaught when rebuilding the Temple (Being surrounded by many players makes this much easier).

items: 5000+ [[coins]] (bring plenty of money just in case)
2 [[Tarromin potion (unf)]] (made by adding 2 clean [[Tarromin]]s (obtainable during quest) to 2 [[Vial of water|vials of water]] (empty vials are obtainable during quest))

Prior to building the temple, you need a [[hammer]] (1 coin at the [[general store]]). However, a regular hammer is insufficient to build the temple without a large group. An additional 13,000 coins (or {{Coins|{{GEP|Flamtaer hammer}}}} on the [[Grand Exchange]]) allows you to buy a [[Flamtaer hammer]] from Razmire, which is necessary to complete this part of the [[quest]] without a group.

shadow_of_the_storm.name: Shadow of the Storm

otherRewards: [[Silverlight]] turns into the [[Darklight]] sword - it has a [[special attack]] and is even more powerful against [[demon]]s. It costs slightly more to replace.
Six cut gems: two [[sapphire]]s, two [[rubies]] and two [[emerald]]s, if you use a hammer and chisel on the demon's throne and had not yet removed them during [[The Golem]].

[[Agrith-Naar]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

shadow_of_the_storm.start: Speak to [[Father Reen]], south of [[Al Kharid]] bank.
shadow_of_the_storm.description: A sinister group of dark wizards is attempting to summon Agrith-Naar, a demon of exceptional mystical power. Rather than try to prevent them, a Saradominist priest asks the player to help summon the demon and then kill it once and for all. But all is not as it seems...

other: The ability to defeat a level 100 demon

items: Any black outfit (minimum of 3 pieces, see [[Shadow_of_the_Storm#Starting_Out|below]] for the allowed gear — the dyed [[Silverlight]] '''does not''' count as a piece of black clothing)
[[Black dye]] (from grinding a black mushroom using a pestle and mortar alongside a vial)
Means to enter the desert (such as the [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]], [[Desert amulet 2]], [[Teleport tablets]] or [[Teleport scrolls|scrolls]], [[Fairy rings]] or the [[Pharaoh's sceptre]])

sheep_herder.name: Sheep Herder

sheep_herder.description: Dispose of plagued sheep and save Ardougne!

items: [[Shears]] to obtain [[wool]] to spin into balls of wool (obtained during the quest)

shield_of_arrav.description: Varrockian literature tells of a valuable shield, stolen long ago from the museum of [[Varrock]], by a gang of professional thieves. See if you can track down this shield and return it to the museum. You will need a friend to help you complete this quest.
items: Black Arm Gang: 2 [[Phoenix crossbow]]s (obtained during the quest)
shield_of_arrav.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Misthalin}} — location requirementUnlocking {{RE|Fremennik}} {{okay}} will auto-complete the quest</poem>

otherRewards: Access to [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]]
Ability to quick travel to Shilo Village using the [[Shilo Village cart system|cart]] near the [[Brimhaven]] docks
Ability to mine the [[gem rocks]] in [[Shilo Village mine]].

[[Nazastarool]] accessible in the [[Nightmare Zone]].

shilo_village.description: New areas in the southern part of Karamja Island have been discovered with a mysterious village. Who knows what hidden treasures exist, and what dangers lurk to guard them?
items: A lit [[torch]] or [[candle]] ([[lantern]]s or a [[Firemaking cape]] don't work) (a [[bruma torch]] will work, but '''you will not get this item back''')
[[Bronze wire]] (can be made from scratch using the General Store and Anvil north of [[Tai Bwo Wannai]])
3 regular [[bones]] (obtainable during quest, only ''normal'' bones work; a spare is a good idea in case you bury one)

ironman: {{SCP|Smithing|4|linkyes}} {{Boostable|yes}} (to make a [[bronze wire]])

sins_of_the_father.name: Sins of the Father

otherRewards: Access to [[Darkmeyer]]
*Access to the [[Daeyalt Essence Mine]]
*Access to the [[Hallowed Sepulchre]]
*Ability to shop at stores in Darkmeyer while wearing [[Vyre noble clothing]]
*Ability to use the [[Wall (Darkmeyer)|wall]] shortcut on the eastern side of Darkmeyer with 63 Agility, after purchasing two [[long rope]]s from the [[Darkmeyer General Store]] and using them on it.
The [[Blisterwood flail]]
Darkmeyer teleport via [[Drakan's medallion]]

sins_of_the_father.start: Speak to [[Veliaf Hurtz]] outside the church in [[Slepe]].
sins_of_the_father.description: A darkness has fallen over Morytania. The Myreque freedom fighters have achieved their first major victory over the vampyres with the death of [[Ranis Drakan]]. However, their newly found hope is unlikely to last. After many years of absence, [[Lord Lowerniel Vergidiyad Drakan|Lord Lowerniel Drakan]], the vampyre overlord of Morytania, has finally emerged from his castle. He has but one goal. To avenge his brother and eradicate the Myreque once and for all.
items: [[Vyrewatch outfit]] ([[Vyrewatch top|top]], [[Vyrewatch legs|legs]], and [[Vyrewatch shoes|shoes]]) or 1,950 coins to purchase it from [[Trader Sven's Black-market Goods]] (can be obtained during quest)
Runes for [[Lvl-3 Enchant]] (1 [[cosmic rune]], 5 [[fire rune]]s) or an [[enchant ruby or topaz]] tablet
sins_of_the_father.leagueRegion: <poem>{{RE|Morytania}} — location requirement</poem>Players attempting to start the quest may find that [[Veliaf Hurtz]] is not present in [[Slepe]]. If this happens, he must first be interacted with in the [[Burgh de Rott]] basement, he will then appear in Slepe.

sleeping_giants.name: Sleeping Giants

otherRewards: Access to the [[Giants' Foundry]]

sleeping_giants.start: Speak to [[Kovac]] at the [[Giants' Plateau]], east of [[Al Kharid]].
sleeping_giants.description: Ahh, giants. We all know them. Enormous humanoids hanging about Gielinor, simply minding their own business until some adventurer or another comes along to beat them up. But how much do we really know about these giants? What do they think about? Where did they come from? Would they enjoy making massive swords in some kind of... gargantuan workshop? All these questions, and more, will be answered in the quest Sleeping Giants! You'll help Kovac, a friendly giant who's discovered an ancient forge built to his giant-size proportions!
items: [[Hammer]] or [[Imcando hammer]] (Other types of hammers will not work)
1 [[bucket of water]] (Obtainable during quest) or [[ice gloves]]
ironman: [[File:Ultimate_ironman_chat_badge.png]] 20 empty inventory spaces needed to search a crate.

the_slug_menace.name: The Slug Menace

You can buy each piece individually, or buy the armour pack which, when opened, gives you the [[Proselyte hauberk|plate]], [[Proselyte sallet|helm]], and [[Proselyte cuisse|legs]]/[[Proselyte tasset|tassets]] all at once. The pack costs 25,000 coins
*Buying the upgraded armour in separate pieces costs more: the helm costs 8,000 coins, the platelegs and plateskirt cost 10,000 coins, and the platebody costs 12,000 coins for a total of 30,000 coins
*Required for the [[hard Falador Diary]]

the_slug_menace.description: The small village of [[Witchaven]] was all but deserted when the [[Fishing Platform]] was built a short ways off the coast. Now, some of the inhabitants of the village have been acting somewhat strangely....

At least 5 [[rune essence|rune]]/[[pure essence]] (bring 15–20 in case they shatter; succeeding with 5 is very unlikely)
Access to the [[Air Altar|Air]], [[Water Altar|Water]], [[Earth Altar|Earth]], [[Fire Altar|Fire]] and [[Mind Altar]]s

song_of_the_elves.start: Talk to [[Edmond]], who can be found at his home in East Ardougne, north of the [[Flying Horse Inn]].
song_of_the_elves.description: Our story begins with you, the hero, answering the call to adventure when Edmond, a resident of Ardougne, asks for your aid. By rescuing his daughter Elena from Plague City, the quarantined West Ardougne, you begin to unravel the mystery surrounding the disease. With her help, you discover the plague is a hoax - a plot by King Lathas to section off the West Ardougne. By confronting him, you find out this was done to protect the rest of Gielinor from the threat in the elven lands. The king sends you on a mission to travel through the Underground Pass and help his ally, Lord Iorwerth, in eradicating his brother King Tyras who threatens to revive the mysterious Dark Lord. After an arduous journey through the pass, you meet with Iorwerth and his forces to end Tyras' evil once and for all. Upon your return to Lathas you are intercepted by Arianwyn, a rebel elf who opposes Lord Iorwerth. He informs you of Lathas and Iorwerth's deception. They manipulated you into removing their final opposition and were now free to bring the Dark Lord back to Gielinor for their own intentions. You work with the elven rebellion to discover the purpose of the plague was to disguise the digsite of the long lost Temple of Light. An ancient place that is key to bringing back the Dark Lord. To make amends for your past mistakes and put a halt in King Lathas' and Lord Iorwerth's plans, you solve the intricate light puzzle designed to protect the Death Altar within the temple. After sealing off the temple and preventing the return of the Dark Lord, it's now time to turn your attention to King Lathas and Lord Iorwerth to end their schemes once and for all in Song of the Elves.
items: [[Mourner gear]] including [[gas mask]] ([[plague jacket]] and [[plague trousers|trousers]] do not work)
[[Flowers]] from [[mithril seeds]] or [[adamant seeds]], or an [[irit leaf]]

a_souls_bane.start: Go east of [[Varrock]], through the gate by the [[Earth Altar]] and just south of there, speak to [[Launa]].
a_souls_bane.description: A rift in the ground has opened up releasing all manner of strange monsters into the lands near the Digsite. A sorrowful mother waits at the top of the rift for her long lost son, who has been missing for 25 years. You can journey down into the rift for an adventure full of twisted monsters all created from the mind of a young boy driven to madness through incarceration.

spirits_of_the_elid.update: Nardah, Tool Sheds & Spirits of the Elid
spirits_of_the_elid.description: The people in the desert village of Nardah have a problem. Their town well has dried up and any water they try to bring back to the town from the river mysteriously disappears before they can get it back. The villagers suspect they have been cursed in some way. Can you unravel what is going on and save the village?

other: Ability to defeat three level 75 golems

swan_song.name: Swan Song
swan_song.update: Return of the Wise Old Man!

otherRewards: Access to the [[Piscatoris Fishing Colony]]
*The ability to fish [[monkfish]]
*The ability to use [[Skeleton Mage]]s for training

swan_song.start: The [[Piscatoris Fishing Colony]]. It can be reached via a boat trip from the river to the west of the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]].
swan_song.description: Out on the edge of the known world, the Piscatoris Fishing Colony stands on the brink of disaster. Angry sea trolls are emerging from the sea and attacking the colonists, preventing them from harvesting the valuable monkfish that live in those waters. A highly experienced adventurer will be needed to drive back the trolls for good. The Colony's director, Herman Caranos, has a particular adventurer in mind: the notoriously amoral Wise Old Man of Draynor Village (allegations of his involvement in a spectacular bank robbery have never been substantiated). If you're in the mood for a bit of combat, jump on the boat on the west side of the Gnome Stronghold, speak to the Colony's director and prepare to fight alongside the Wise Old Man as he embarks on his final adventure - his ''swan song''.
items: An [[airtight pot]] – created by using a [[pot lid]] on a [[pot]]
1 set of [[logs]] of any kind, or

tale_of_the_righteous.description: Over a thousand years ago, King Shayzien VII ordered an expedition to Mount Quidamortem. The expedition never returned and it was assumed that all members perished in the field. However, a recent discovery suggests this may not have been the case. Phileas Rimor is the descendant of the expedition leader and he is desperate to discover the truth. Join him and delve into a conspiracy a thousand years in the making in "Tale of the Righteous".

a_taste_of_hope.start: Speak to [[Garth (Theatre of Blood)|Garth]] in [[Ver Sinhaza]] by the entrance to the [[Theatre of Blood]].
a_taste_of_hope.description: For many years, the Myreque have fought back against the reign of the Drakans. To many, they act as a glimmer of hope in an otherwise miserable existence. In recent times, the Myreque have been beset by disaster, with numerous members meeting a gruesome end at the hands of Vanstrom Klause, the brutal henchman of the Drakans. However, while the Myreque may be in their darkest hour, hope still remains. Thanks to a recent discovery in the laboratories deep beneath Meiyerditch, the Myreque may have finally found a way to take the fight to the vampyres.

tears_of_guthix.description: Deep in the caves in the [[Lumbridge Swamp]] is an enchanted place where the tears shed by [[Guthix]] when it saw the destruction [[Saradomin]] and [[Zamorak]] had caused with their wars flow from the very walls. These tears are said to have magical properties to help players gain deeper understanding of the world. However, the cave is guarded by a loyal serpent named [[Juna]] who blocks passage from everyone. However, she has grown bored from three thousand years of sitting in the dark cave and wishes to hear stories of life above. Maybe you could come to some sort of arrangement...?

The secrets of this plane have long eluded the denizens of the Wizards' Tower, though some would give anything to properly uncover them. One of these wizards is Persten. While many in the Tower aren't convinced by her unorthodox methods, a recent discovery means she may now hold the key to the knowledge they crave the most. However, nothing is simple when the Abyss is involved, and Persten won't be able to get to the bottom of her discovery without your help...

while_guthix_sleeps.description: This Grandmaster quest sees you continue the Mahjarrat storyline, hunting down one of the most powerful artefacts in existence while ensuring it doesn't fall into the wrong hands. This artefact is known by many names – most recently, the Stone of Jas. It has shaped the course of Gielinor’s history, from the creation of the first Runes to the fall of Zaros. It was last seen at the devastating end of the God Wars, when Zamorak, in a fit of rage, used it to reduce the land of Forinthry to the Wilderness we know today. Angered by Zamorak’s actions, Guthix rose from his age-long slumber and banished the gods. He hid the Stone of Jas far underground, where it could never disturb the balance again... But while Guthix sleeps, nefarious forces have been gathering: the Mahjarrat. Shaped by war and deadly ritual, their plans for the Stone can only lead to catastrophe. Facing off against the Mahjarrat is nothing new for dedicated adventurers – at every turn, they seem to grow in power and wage war against the people of Gielinor. In their last attempt, we saw them set out to tear Varrock apart with an undead army in Defender of Varrock. What are they plotting now?
items: [[Seed dibber]] (only if Barbarian Farming Training has not been completed)
Runes to cast the [[NPC Contact]] spell four times (8 [[air rune]]s, 4 [[astral rune]], 4 [[cosmic rune]])
Runes for any charge orb spell (30 runes of a chosen element and 3 [[cosmic rune]]s)
Equipment for two different combat styles
1 [[log]] of any type except redwood (you can obtain one using a bronze axe next to the [[Hunting Expert]])
One of each of the following runes: [[air rune|air]], [[water rune|water]], [[earth rune|earth]], [[fire rune|fire]], [[mind rune|mind]], [[law rune|law]], [[death rune|death]]
